laboratory_examinations.findings: 1.4 mg/dL (baseline 0.4 mg/dL 4 months prior), 5.8 mg/dL when treatment started, declined to a nadir of 0.9 mg/dL after treatment.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially increased from 0.4 mg/dL to 1.4 mg/dL, peaked at 5.8 mg/dL, then declined to 0.9 mg/dL after high-dose corticosteroid treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 43 mL/min/1.73 m² at presentation, improved to 67 mL/min/1.73 m² after treatment.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially decreased to 43 mL/min/1.73 m², improved to 67 mL/min/1.73 m² after treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Specific gravity 1.018, pH 7, small ketones, moderate proteinuria, 0-2 red blood cells/hpf, 11 white blood cells/hpf.
Hemoglobin 9.3 g/dL, white blood cells 1.1 x 10^9/L, platelet count 653 x 10^9/L.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Ferritin and soluble IL-2 receptor levels
laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated and significantly above age-adjusted normal ranges.
